DataElement.preferredName: Patient Consent Neoplasm Biopsy Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The coded response indicating a patient's willingness to undergo a tumor biopsy that meets the criteria for participation in a clinical trial.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Consent Neoplasm Biopsy Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary._Permission to do something._A benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation. Benign neoplastic cells resemble normal cells without exhibiting significant cytologic atypia, while malignant cells exhibit overt signs such as dysplastic features, atypical mitotic figures, necrosis, nuclear pleomorphism, and anaplasia. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papillomas, cystadenomas, and lipomas; malignant neoplasms include carcinomas, sarcomas, lymphomas, and leukemias._The removal of tissue specimens or fluid from the living body for microscopic examination, performed to establish a diagnosis._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: Consent Neoplasm Biopsy Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: Permission to do something.:A benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation. Benign neoplastic cells resemble normal cells without exhibiting significant cytologic atypia, while malignant cells exhibit overt signs such as dysplastic features, atypical mitotic figures, necrosis, nuclear pleomorphism, and anaplasia. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papillomas, cystadenomas, and lipomas; malignant neoplasms include carcinomas, sarcomas, lymphomas, and leukemias.:The removal of tissue specimens or fluid from the living body for microscopic examination, performed to establish a diagnosis.:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: A benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation. Benign neoplastic cells resemble normal cells without exhibiting significant cytologic atypia, while malignant cells exhibit overt signs such as dysplastic features, atypical mitotic figures, necrosis, nuclear pleomorphism, and anaplasia. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papillomas, cystadenomas, and lipomas; malignant neoplasms include carcinomas, sarcomas, lymphomas, and leukemias.
The removal of tissue specimens or fluid from the living body for microscopic examination, performed to establish a diagnosis.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator to represent a response of Yes, No, or Not Applicable._The affirmative response to a question or activity._The non-affirmative response to a question._Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Is patient willing to undergo
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient willing to undergo a tumor biopsy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient willing to undergo mandatory biopsies?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient willing to undergo a biopsy prior to treatment and repeat biopsy at week 16 (for the first 20 patients in the phase 2 part of the study)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient able and willing to undergo serial biopsies of injected lesion(s) and, when applicable and clinically feasible, non-injected lesions?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient able and willing to provide bone marrow biopsies/aspirates as requested by the protocol?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient is enrolled in Phase II: Patient is willing to undergo 2 sets of core needle biopsies (pre-treatment and on-treatment), if there are lesions amenable to biopsy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient willing to undergo biopsies?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have disease amenable to biopsy and agrees to have one baseline biopsy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 9
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient willing to undergo core biopsy of a recurrent/metastatic lesion adequate for next generation sequencing prior to trial entry?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 8
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient able and willing to provide bone marrow biopsies/aspirates and buccal mucosa sample as requested by the protocol?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 10
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient willing to undergo interim bone marrow biopsy/aspiration for clinical purposes?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 12
ReferenceDocuments.description: If feasible, is patient willing and able to undergo biopsy of radiotracer-avid lesion?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 13
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient is one of the first 9 patients enrolled to the study, is patient willing to undergo endoscopic tumor biopsies for mandatory correlative studies?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 14
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient willing to undergo a biopsy prior to treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 11
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient willing to undergo core biopsy of a recurrent/metastatic lesion adequate for next generation sequencing (NGS) after trial registration but prior to cycle 1 day 1 of therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 15
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient agree to provide an Archival tumor specimen at baseline?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 16
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient is registered in dose expansion, is patient willing to undergo biopsies for research purposes only?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 17
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient willing to undergo tumor biopsies during the trial when feasible?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 18
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient willing to undergo 2 sets of core needle biopsies?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 19
ReferenceDocuments.description: For Patients Enrolled in the Expansion Cohort: Is patient willing to undergo mandatory biopsies (day -13, approximately 18 to 22 hours post end of irinotecan infusion and Day 2, approximately 18 to 22 hours post end of irinotecan infusion (= 17 to 21 hours post end of M6620 (VX-970, berzosertib))?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 20
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient willing to undergo mandatory biopsies?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 21
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient is enrolled to the expansion cohort, is pre- and post-treatment biopsy feasible and patient is willing to undergo pre and post treatment biopsy?
